itemDescription: Church of Scotland minister and university principal

wikipedia_page.main: Duncan Macfarlan (1771–1857) was a Scottish minister. He was twice Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland both in 1819 and in its most critical year of 1843. He was Principal of Glasgow University from 1823 to 1857.

response: * Duncan Macfarlan, minister of Drymen church and principal of the University of Glasgow.

link_mentions.page: List of Moderators of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland
response: *1819 and 1843 Duncan Macfarlan (Drymen, later Principal of the University of Glasgow)

The "Disruption" in the Church of Scotland took place in 1843, with approximately one-third of the ministers leaving to form the Free Church of Scotland. The Moderator in this critical year was Duncan Macfarlan (High Church of Glasgow)

link_mentions.page: Principal of the University of Glasgow

response: In May 1818 he succeeded Rev Gavin Gibb as Moderator of the General Assembly, and was succeeded in turn in 1819 by Rev Duncan Macfarlan.https://www.geni.com/projects/Moderators-of-the-General-Assembly-of-the-Church-of-Scotland/15939
